title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Thomas P. Jackson to Orlando Brown, January 31, 1868
summary: In his report, Jackson comments on the continuing problem of contract negotiation and disputed wages between employers and laborers. He also worries about conservative whites' efforts to "defeat the Constitution."
keywords: Aid/Relief, Community Values/Local Behavior, Employment/Labor, Politics/Political Attitudes, Race Relations, Violence/Crime, American Civil War
